                                            By 
                                                    Jeff Greenfield


                                            By 
                                                    Rich Lowry


                                            By 
Jack Shafer


                                            By 
                                                    Neera Tanden


                        The former Florida governor has suddenly became very bro. 

            By 
Nolan D. McCaskill

11/12/15 11:43 AM EST
Jeb Bush, once the "joyful tortoise" playing the long game in the presidential race, has come out of his shell. What's emerged? Macho Jeb!
The former Florida governor has been reinventing himself as he seeks to calm his "nervous Nellie" donors concerned about his flailing poll numbers and a series of underwhelming debate performances. 
Story Continued Below
His campaign has rebooted with a "Jeb Can Fix It" slogan, and the self-described introvert has gone on a bro spree, trying to prove to voters that he has the guts and determination to dominate the still-unwieldy GOP field. 
Here are just a few ways Macho Jeb has made his mark in recent days:
1. When a voter told Bush he was switching his support from Texas Sen. Ted Cruz to Bush, the 6-foot-3 presidential candidate responded with an awkward chest bump. Bush didn't stop there. He's now offering chest bumps to any converts.
Cruz supporter tells Bush he's now backing him instead. Bush gives him a chest bump. pic.twitter.com/S201SJEabh
— Ashley Killough (@KilloughCNN) November 12, 2015
2. Bush is so tough, he says, he eats nails before breakfast. He even has the picture to prove it.
 
The waiters had a little fun with me this AM. #nailsforbreakfast pic.twitter.com/S2Zpb3I3Yr
— Jeb Bush (@JebBush) November 8, 2015
3. He’s also handy. Give Bush just about any problem and #JebCanFixIt. The Bush campaign launched this initiative earlier this month, much to the delight of Twitter.
 
Is he running for President or Plumber? #JebCanFixIt pic.twitter.com/nn9QaXO6MS
— Carl J Gerber (@ConstantNSharp) November 2, 2015
4. Bush is also a winner, something on his to-do list in Iowa.
To-do list from the Iowa field office: pic.twitter.com/xViJLYvSMe
— Jeb Bush (@JebBush) November 9, 2015
5. Bush is a jock, pre-gaming for the fourth presidential debate with some competition on the bocce ball court. 
New pre-debate ritual: Bocce ball. pic.twitter.com/J1aRyy5KuT
— Jeb Bush (@JebBush) November 11, 2015
6. Bush is so tough that he would kill Baby Hitler, a question first posed by New York Times Magazine: “Hell yeah, I would,” Bush told Huffington Post this week. “You gotta step up, man.”
7. And let’s not forget his low-five with Donald Trump during September’s GOP debate.
 
via GIPHY

 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: The former Florida governor has suddenly became very bro.
title: Jeb goes mas macho on the campaign trail
